item.title: Halloween Jewelry: 10/20/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Make a cool leather cuff and dangly jack-o-lantern earrings with Allie Silverstein. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on October 20, 2016.

item.title: Daily Creativity Challenge
item.author: Creativebug
item.description: The team at Creativebug is surrounded by inspiration every day, but even the most prolific amongst us needs a jumpstart now and then. We asked members of our staff to share their go-to tips for finding creativity when the well has run dry. Their answers are as versatile as the artists themselves. Each day this month, members of our staff will be sharing their favorite ways to stoke the creative fires. Join us for a month of painting, drawing, journaling, organizing, upcycling, beautifying, and so much more.

item.title: Leather Wrap Bracelet
item.author: Melanie Falick
item.description: A stack of these bracelets adds understated glamour to any outfit. Melanie Falick guides you through the range of supplies and how to vary the look depending on your design choices. You will learn the mechanics of stringing the bracelet, as well as how to add more thread and make the bracelet long enough to wrap around your wrist several times.

item.title: Make a Beaded Leather Tassel Necklace
item.author: Elke Bergeron
item.description: In this class, Elke shares instructions for making one of her signature creations: a bohemian leather tassel necklace. She begins by teaching you how to make the leather tassel, and then demonstrates how to add the beads and leather lacing. This is a great project for beginning beaders and leatherworkersâ€” experiment with color combinations and styles to make a necklace with boho charm.

item.title: Bead-Weaving Roundabout Necklace
item.author: Liz Smith
item.description: In this class, beading expert Liz will show you how to make a chic, versatile necklace that can be worn in any direction. The necklace begins with a beautiful bead-weaving section, comprised of both twisted spiral stitch and herringbone stitch with silver and gold beads. After the bead-weaving is complete, gold and silver chains are attached, and the necklace is finished with decorative clasps. You can make the necklace short or long, in vibrant colors or metallic hues—the choice is up to you. It's easy to customize, fun to make, and even more fun to wear.

item.title: Turkish Flat Weave Bracelet
item.author: Alix Bluh

item.title: Magpie Cuff
item.author: Liz Smith
item.description: This cuff incorporates odds and ends of different yarn, fibers and beads. Liz teaches a freeform approach to looming, showing you how to set up a loom and basic weaving techniques with her “over, under, over under” mantra. You design as you go, resulting in a modern asymmetrical, textured cuff.

item.title: Crystal Cuff Bracelet
item.author: Liz Smith
item.description: If you have a hankering for some bling, this workshop is for you. You’ll learn bead-weaving skills that can be customized to accommodate your own color and style preferences. Liz will show you how to create a three-row cuff, but you can stop at just one row or keeping adding as many rows as you desire to create the width you prefer.

item.title: Scheherazade Necklace
item.author: Liz Smith
item.description: This beaded “ribbon” necklace builds on basic bead-weaving skills. You’ll learn an even count peyote stitch and several embellishment designs that you can use to create this necklace or apply to other beading projects. You’ll learn all of these techniques, plus how to make a bead “soup” and anchor your threads so all your precious work stays secure.

item.title: Found Necklace
item.author: Lisa Coris
item.description: This workshop will open your eyes to the possibilities of finding necklace materials beyond the bead store. Lisa’s philosophy of creating bright, accessible jewelry shines through as she teaches you how to creatively repurpose existing necklaces along with tricks for simple strung necklaces.

item.title: Herringbone Necklace
item.author: Lisa Coris
item.description: Go on a field trip with Lisa as she sources vintage beads in her favorite bead shop. This simple necklace combines an unusual variety of beads, from brass to coconut to plastic. No jewelry tools required, just a love of exploring color and trust that working without a plan can lead to exciting color and texture combinations.
